Joel Lee

  • Hi, my name is Joel! I work in the Digital Scholarship Group at Northeastern Library. I am currently working on the Civil Rights and Restorative Justice Project, the Boston Research Center, and projects with the Massachusetts Historical Society and Digital Humanities Quarterly. I previously was a researcher and fellow in Digital Humanities at the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum, and before that I worked as a student with the Price Lab for Digital Humanities and Penn Libraries.
  • I have many people to thank who have been mentors, friends, and role models, including Jim English, Stewart Varner, Silvina Fernandez-Duque, Benjamin Lee, Robert Ehrenreich, Eric Schmalz, Russ Sitka, William Mattingly, Liz Polcha, and lastly Scott Enderle, whose support for me while I was a student was truly formative. Without Scott, I would have never been involved in DH, and I dedicate all my work to his kindness and thoughtfulness.
